result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Iyesha J Southern

records.addlTxt: Order Denying Court Appointed Counsel, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 19th, 2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Iyesha J Southern in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant will proceed without counsel.  State has offer to amend to a county ordinance with a domestic violence enhancer if the defendant completes AODA assessment and counseling, domestic violence counseling and pays up front restitution if requested.  The defendant indicates she does not understand the offer or how to proceed.  The Court inquires again of the defendant in regards to obtaining counsel and conducts colloquy as to her financial circumstances.  The Court finds the defendant  would not qualify for Public Defender Representation.  Court takes recess at 1:37 pm so the defendant may fill out the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Case recalled at 1:47 pm with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court denies request and finds the defendant not indigent.  The Court will adjourn for an additional status date so the defendant may decide if she would like to retain counsel and how she would like to proceed with this case as to the offer provided by the State today.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

to the Court requesting adjournment of 8/29 hearing filed by defendant.

   **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/08/22--approved; please set court date after 9/16.**
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 08/01/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A (once the 72 hour no contact is expired) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

01:38 PM Defendant Iyesha J Southern in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
